questionText: A number 500 is increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%. What is the final number?

A train covers 360 km total in 4 hours. It travels the first half (180 km) at 60 km/h. What is its speed in the second half?
A sum amounts to ₹12,000 in 2 years at simple interest of 10% p.a. What was the principal?
Average age of 5 family members is 25 years. The youngest is 15. Average age of the other 4 members is:
Two numbers are in the ratio 5:7 and their sum is 144. The numbers are:
A man spends 40% of income on rent, 30% on food and saves the rest ₹12,000. His monthly income is:
5 men complete a job in 12 days. How many days will 8 men take (same work, equal efficiency)?
Price of a commodity increases by 25%. By what percent should consumption be reduced to keep expenditure same?

Find the next number: 5, 9, 17, 33, ?

Which of these is not a perfect square?

In a row of 25 boys, A is 8th from the left and B is 12th from the right. How many boys are between A and B?
A clock shows 4:30. What is the angle between hour and minute hands?

A shopkeeper marks a product 20% above cost and gives 10% discount on marked price. Profit % is:

A sum doubles itself in 8 years at simple interest. Find annual rate of interest.
Person walks at 4 km/h and runs at 8 km/h. Total distance 24 km covered in 4 hours. How much distance he walked?
A two-digit number minus the number with digits reversed equals 36. The difference between its digits is:

Which statement will delete only the data inside a table, not the table itself?

Which JOIN returns all rows from both tables, with NULL where there’s no match?
Which function is used to get the current system date in MySQL?
What is the output of: SELECT 15/2; in MySQL (default settings)?
Which of these is a valid way to rename a column in SQL Server?
optionA: ALTER TABLE RENAME COLUMN old_name TO new_name;

questionText: The result of WHERE salary BETWEEN 5000 AND 10000 includes:

In C++, which type of inheritance allows a class to inherit from more than one base class?

Which concept allows using the same function name but different parameter lists?
Which OOP principle hides internal details and shows only essential features?

Which type of constructor initializes objects with values provided at runtime?

Which keyword prevents a base class function from being overridden?
Which constructor is called when an object is initialized from another object of the same class?
In C++, friend functions:
optionC: Can access private data of the class

questionText: Which of these best describes polymorphism?
optionC: One function behaving differently for different objects

questionText: Destructor in C++:
optionD: Has the same name as the class prefixed with ~
